snippet: Congressional leaders dug in their heels against any quick deal to resolve a looming fiscal disaster before the election, even as the ratings agency warned of a downgrade if no solution was found by year’s end.
abstract: Congressional leaders dig in their heels against any quick deal to resolve a looming fiscal disaster before the November election, even as the ratings agency Moody's Investor Service warns that it will downgrade the government's debt if no solution is found by year’s end.

byline.contributor: Jada F. Smith and Jennifer Steinhauer contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: Congressional leaders dug in their heels against any quick deal to resolve a looming fiscal disaster before the election, even as the ratings agency warned of a downgrade if no solution was found by year’s end.

headline.main: Moody’s Warns That U.S. May Face Debt Downgrade
headline.print_headline: Moody’s Warns That U.S. May Face Debt Downgrade

keywords.value: Credit Ratings and Credit Rating Agencies
keywords.name: subject
